interface package

Submodules

interface.actions module

interface.actions.calculate_late_penalty(delayed_time: timedelta, thresholds: List[timedelta], penalties: List[int]) → int[source]

Calculates the late submission penalty that should be added to a student based on how delayed the submission is. The number of late submission brackets is decided by taking the minimum number of elements available in two lists, thresholds and penalties.

Parameters:

  • delayed_time – How late the submission is from the deadline

  • thresholds – A list containing threshold values for each late submission bracket

  • penalties – A list of penalties for each bracket

Returns:

The submission penalty as an integer

interface.actions.check_late_submission(available_classes: List[str], lab_path: str, deadline: Deadline, assign=False) → Dict[str, datetime][source]

Takes the available classes and the lab path as the input and checks the time of the last submission for each student. Opens the log file of each submission and reads the final line to get the last submitted time. Then compares this value with the curr_deadline. If the deadline is exceeded, based on the delayed time calculates the penalty.

Parameters:

  • available_classes – List of available classes for selected lab

  • lab_path – Absolute file path to the lab folder containing the classes

  • deadline – Deadline for the selected lab

  • assign – If ture, uses assignment deadline parameters

Returns:

A dictionary containing student id as key and the final submission timestamp as the value

interface.actions.check_new_submissions(ssh_client: Client, term: str, classes: List[str], l_labs_path: str) → None[source]

Check whether there are updated or new submissions since the last download of a lab. If there are, the updated submissions are printed to the console.

Parameters:

  • ssh_client – A Client object with a connected SSH session

  • term – From which term these labs should be checked for updates

  • classes – The set of classes the user teaches for that term

  • l_labs_path – Location of the last download submissions of the lab

interface.actions.check_pre_download_conditions(destination_path: str, lab_name: str) → bool[source]

Before downloading the labs, check whether there are pre-existing submissions of the same lab in the download location. The user can select whether to overwrite these files if they exist, or they will be moved to a hidden folder prefixed with .lastrun and the new labs will be downloaded.

Parameters:

  • destination_path – Location where the downloaded labs should be saved locally

  • lab_name – Name of the lab being downloaded

Returns:

Returns False if the user aborts the process

interface.actions.download_labs(ssh_client: Client, term: str, dest_path: str, class_names: List[str]) → None[source]

Connects to cse servers through SSH and downloads the submissions of all the classes defined in the config file.

Parameters:

  • ssh_client – A Client object with a connected SSH session

  • term – From which term these labs should be downloaded

  • dest_path – The location of the local save path for the lab directory

  • class_names – The set of classes the user teaches for that term

interface.actions.extract_all_submissions(lab_path: str) → None[source]

Iterates through all student directories under all classes in a lab path and extracts the content inside the file ‘submission.tar’. Once the files are extracted, checks whether there are new .tar files created. If so, iterates through all the new files and untar the new .tar files.

Parameters:

lab_path – Directory path of the lab

Returns:

None

interface.actions.get_deadline_info(deadline: Deadline, assign=False) → Tuple[datetime, List[timedelta], List[int]][source]

Extract the current deadline, thresholds, and penalty values from the config file. The thresholds and penalties lists can have different number of elements. In such a case the minimum number of elements of both is selected. eg:

Threshold: [30, 1440, 2880, 4320, 5760]

Penalties: [0, 5, 10]

Then the code will consider as there are only 3 penalty brackets.

Parameters:

  • deadline – The deadline of the current lab

  • assign – If true, the extended deadline system for assignments will be used

Returns:

A tuple containing the current deadline, thresholds, and penalty

interface.actions.get_submission_times(available_classes: List[str], lab_path: str) → Tuple[Dict[str, datetime], Dict[str, str]][source]

Iterates through all submissions inside the lab directory and extract the final submission from each submission. These are stored in a dictionary with the zID as the key and the time as the key. If there is an error with opening or reading the logfile, this information will be written to the error dict in the above same format.

Parameters:

  • available_classes – List of available classes for selected lab

  • lab_path – Absolute file path to the lab folder containing the classes

Returns:

Two dictionaries containing the submission times and errors

interface.actions.lab_selection(local_all_labs_path: str) → Tuple[List[str], str][source]

Lists down all available labs in the given path and prompts the user to pick a specific lab number. If the input lab number is present, returns all class names under the given lab and their respective directory paths

Parameters:

local_all_labs_path – Path of the local save location of all labs

Returns:

The available class names (eg: ‘fri09-oboe’) in the lab and the path of the lab directory

interface.actions.print_and_get_sub_selection(lab_names: List[str]) → int[source]

Print all the labs in the list to the terminal with the corresponding index. Then waits for the user input to select a lab based on the index. Returns the selected lab index to the calling function. Performs basic input verification.

Parameters:

lab_names – A list of lab names as strings

Returns:

The index of the selected lab

interface.actions.remove_extracted(lab_path: str) → None[source]

Iterates through all student directories under all classes in a lab path and removes all extracted files leaving out only the student submitted .tar files and the log file

Parameters:

lab_path – Directory path of the lab

interface.remote module

interface.remote.download_labs_all_classes(ssh_client: Client, term: str, lab_name: str, class_names: List[str], save_path: str) → None[source]

Downloads all available submissions in the list of class names given.

Parameters:

  • ssh_client – A Client object with a connected SSH session

  • term – From which term these labs should be downloaded

  • lab_name – The lab selected

  • class_names – The set of classes the submissions should be downloaded from

  • save_path – The location of the local save path for the downloaded files

Returns:

interface.remote.get_log_paths(ssh_client: Client, term: str, classes: List[str]) → Tuple[List[str], str][source]

Prompts the user to select the lab they want to check for updates. Then search lab directory at the SSH client to find all log files present in the directory and generated a list containing paths to all the identified log files.

Parameters:

  • ssh_client – A Client object with a connected SSH session

  • term – From which term these labs should be checked for updates

  • classes – The set of classes the user teaches for that term

Returns:

A tuple containing the identified log paths and the user selected lab

interface.utils module

interface.utils.extract_all(tar_file_path: str, extract_path: str) → None[source]

Recursively extracts all .tar files inside submission.tar and save the output of all extractions in extract_path.

Parameters:

  • tar_file_path – Path to the tar file that should be extracted

  • extract_path – Save location of the untar content

interface.utils.get_user_selection(available_options: List[str]) → str[source]

Given a list of lab names, print them to the console in a user-friendly format and waits for the user to make a selection. The selection is validated against non-integer and out of range inputs.

Parameters:

available_options – A list of labs

Returns:

Name on the user selected lab

interface.utils.parse_time_from_log(log_path: str) → datetime[source]

Opens the log file and extracts the last line to read the final submission time of the student.

Parameters:

log_path – Path to the log file

Returns:

A datetime object of the final submission time
